org.example

Class FullGtfsMerger

  • Object
    • org.example.FullGtfsMerger

  • public class FullGtfsMerger
extends Object
    FullGtfsMerger handles merging multiple GTFS feed folders into a single output folder.

    • Method Detail

      • mergeFeedsFromFolders

        public boolean mergeFeedsFromFolders(String rootFolder,
                                     String outputFolder,
                                     String headerChoice)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
        Merges multiple GTFS feeds located in subfolders of a given root directory into a single output folder.

        This method expects the rootFolder to contain multiple subdirectories, each representing a separate GTFS feed. It validates the input, collects all feed directories, and delegates the merging process to mergeFeedDirs(File[], String, String).

        Parameters:
        rootFolder - the root folder containing subdirectories, each representing a GTFS feed
        outputFolder - the target folder where the merged GTFS output will be saved
        headerChoice - headerChoice Determines how the reference header is chosen: "long" → Choose the header with the most columns. "short" → Choose the header with the fewest columns.
        Returns:
        true if the feeds were merged successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading or writing files
        com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException - if an error occurs while parsing CSV files
        IllegalArgumentException - if rootFolder or outputFolder is null

      • mergeFeedsFromZips

        public boolean mergeFeedsFromZips(String rootFolder,
                                  String outputFolder,
                                  String headerChoice)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
        Merges multiple GTFS feeds from ZIP files located inside a root directory.

        This method looks for all ZIP files in the specified rootFolder, extracts each ZIP file into a temporary folder, and then merges the GTFS feeds contained within these folders into a single output folder.

        Parameters:
        rootFolder - The root folder containing GTFS ZIP files.
        outputFolder - The destination folder where the merged GTFS feed will be saved.
        headerChoice - headerChoice Determines how the reference header is chosen: "long" → Choose the header with the most columns. "short" → Choose the header with the fewest columns.
        Returns:
        true if the merge was successful, false if no ZIP files were found or root folder is invalid.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If any file/folder operation fails (e.g., reading ZIP or writing output).
        com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException - If an error occurs while parsing GTFS CSV files inside ZIPs.
        IllegalArgumentException - If rootFolder or outputFolder is null.

      • mergeFeedDirs

        private boolean mergeFeedDirs(java.io.File[] feedDirs,
                              String outputFolder,
                              String headerChoice)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
        Merges all GTFS files from multiple feed directories into a single output folder.

        This method loops through each GTFS file defined in PRIMARY_ID_FIELDS and calls mergeFileIfExists(File[], String, String, String) to perform the merge. It also ensures that the output folder exists and is not inside the input feed directories.

        Parameters:
        feedDirs - Array of GTFS feed directories to merge.
        outputFolder - The folder where the merged GTFS files will be saved.
        headerChoice - headerChoice Determines how the reference header is chosen: "long" → Choose the header with the most columns. "short" → Choose the header with the fewest columns.
        Returns:
        true if the merge is successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading or writing files.
        com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException - If there is a problem parsing CSV data.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the output folder is inside one of the input feed directories.

      • unzip

        private void unzip(java.io.File zipFile,
                   java.io.File destDir)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Extracts the contents of a ZIP file into a specified destination directory.

        This method iterates through each entry in the ZIP file. If the entry is a directory, it creates the directory in the destination folder. If the entry is a file, it extracts the file to the destination folder, preserving the folder structure.

        Parameters:
        zipFile - The ZIP file to be extracted.
        destDir - The destination directory where the contents of the ZIP file will be extracted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an error reading the ZIP file or writing files to the destination.

      • mergeFileIfExists

        private void mergeFileIfExists(java.io.File[] feedDirs,
                               String outputFolder,
                               String fileName,
                               String headerChoice)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
        Performs the merge operation for a specific file if it exists in any feed folder.
        Parameters:
        feedDirs - Array of feed folder paths to check for the file.
        outputFolder - Path of the folder where the merged file will be saved.
        fileName - Name of the file to merge (e.g., "agency.txt").
        headerChoice - Header type to use in the merged file; "long" or "short".
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading or writing files.
        com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException - If there is a problem reading CSV data.

      • selectHeader

        private String[] selectHeader(java.util.List<java.io.File> inputFiles,
                              String headerChoice)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
        Selects the appropriate CSV header from a list of input files based on the specified choice.

        This method reads the first line (header) from each CSV file in the input list and collects them. Then, depending on the headerChoice parameter, it selects:

        • "long": the header with the most columns
        • "short": the header with the fewest columns
        • any other value: the first header found

        Parameters:
        inputFiles - The list of CSV files to examine for headers.
        headerChoice - The selection criteria for choosing the header: "long", "short", or any other value.
        Returns:
        The selected header as an array of strings.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading any of the CSV files or if no valid headers are found.
        com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException - If a CSV file is malformed.

      • mergeFileMultipleId

        private void mergeFileMultipleId(java.util.List<java.io.File> inputFiles,
                                 java.io.File outputFile,
                                 String[] idFields,
                                 String headerChoice)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
        Merges multiple CSV files that use multiple columns as unique identifiers (composite keys).

        This method reads each CSV file in inputFiles, aligns their columns with a reference header (selected based on headerChoice), and merges rows into a single output file. Rows with the same combination of ID fields are considered duplicates, and the latest encountered row will overwrite the previous one.

        Parameters:
        inputFiles - The list of CSV files to merge.
        outputFile - The file where the merged CSV will be written.
        idFields - Array of column names used as unique identifiers for merging rows.
        headerChoice - Determines which header to use from the input files: "long" for the header with the most columns, "short" for the header with the fewest columns
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading from or writing to a file.
        com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException - If any input CSV file is malformed.

      • mergeFileSingleId

        private void mergeFileSingleId(java.util.List<java.io.File> inputFiles,
                               java.io.File outputFile,
                               String idField,
                               String headerChoice)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException
        Merges multiple CSV files that use a single column as a unique identifier.

        This method reads each CSV file in inputFiles, aligns their columns with a reference header (selected based on headerChoice), and merges rows into a single output file. Rows with the same value in the ID column are considered duplicates, and the latest encountered row will overwrite the previous one. If the specified ID column does not exist, a unique key is generated for each row using UUID.

        Parameters:
        inputFiles - The list of CSV files to merge.
        outputFile - The file where the merged CSV will be written.
        idField - The name of the column used as a unique identifier for merging rows. If null or not present, UUIDs are generated for each row.
        headerChoice - Determines which header to use from the input files: "long" for the header with the most columns, "short" for the header with the fewest columns
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading from or writing to a file.
        com.opencsv.exceptions.CsvValidationException - If any input CSV file is malformed.
